article:
Royal Rumble (2023)

The Royal Rumble was a professional wrestling event produced by WWE (World Wrestling Entertainment), which took place on January 28, 2023, at the Alamodome in San Antonio, Texas. It was the 36th annual Royal Rumble event and featured a card of eleven matches, including two Royal Rumble matches, the main event of which was the men's match.

# Production

## Background

The event was announced on December 13, 2022, by WWE. The company's President and Chief Revenue Officer, Nick Khan, stated that the event would be held at the Alamodome, which had previously hosted WWE events in 1997 and 2009. Tickets for the event went on sale on December 16, 2022.

## Storylines

Leading up to the event, several storylines had developed on the company's two main television programs, Monday Night Raw and Friday Night SmackDown. The men's Royal Rumble match had a number of participants with notable storylines, including Cody Rhodes, Kevin Owens, and Seth Rollins, all of whom were vying for a spot at the top of the card. On the women's side, Rhea Ripley was looking to make a strong statement in the women's Royal Rumble match, while other participants such as Liv Morgan and Shayna Baszler were also looking to make a name for themselves.

# Event

## Preliminary matches

The event began with a match featuring The Street Profits (Angelo Dawkins and Montez Ford) taking on The Usos (Jey Uso and Jimmy Uso) for the Undisputed WWE Tag Team Championship. The match was a high-energy contest, with both teams trading holds and showing off their athleticism. In the end, The Street Profits emerged victorious, retaining their titles.

Next up was a match between Braun Strowman and Ricochet for the Intercontinental Championship. Strowman, who was looking to prove himself as a top contender, dominated the match, using his immense strength to overpower Ricochet. In the end, Strowman emerged victorious, retaining his title.

## Main event

The men's Royal Rumble match was the main event of the evening, with 30 participants competing in the match. The match began with Rey Mysterio and Jinder Mahal as the first two participants, with Mysterio emerging as the first winner. The match saw a number of notable eliminations, including Cody Rhodes being eliminated by Kevin Owens, and Seth Rollins being eliminated by Austin Theory.

As the match wore on, the field began to dwindle, with Rhea Ripley emerging as a strong contender. She was eventually eliminated by Drew McIntyre, but not before she had eliminated several other participants. In the end, it was Cody Rhodes and Austin Theory who emerged as the final two participants, with Rhodes emerging as the winner.

# Reception

The event received positive reviews from critics and fans alike. The men's Royal Rumble match was particularly praised, with many considering it to be one of the best matches of the year. The women's Royal Rumble match was also well-received, with fans praising the athleticism and energy of the participants.

# Aftermath

## Raw

The aftermath of the event saw a number of changes on the Raw brand. Cody Rhodes, who had emerged as the winner of the men's Royal Rumble match, was crowned the number one contender for the Undisputed WWE Championship. Austin Theory, who had come close to winning the match, was also rewarded with a title shot.

On the women's side, Rhea Ripley was awarded a title shot for the Raw Women's Championship, while Liv Morgan and Shayna Baszler were also rewarded with title shots.

## SmackDown

The aftermath of the event also saw a number of changes on the SmackDown brand. The Street Profits, who had emerged as the winners of the tag team match, were crowned the number one contenders for the SmackDown Tag Team Championship. Braun Strowman, who had emerged as the winner of the Intercontinental Championship match, was also rewarded with a title shot.

article:
**Super Bowl LVI**

Super Bowl LVI (56) was the 56th edition of the National Football League (NFL) championship game, played on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California. The Los Angeles Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals by a score of 23-20, earning their second Super Bowl title in franchise history.

**Background**

### Host selection process

SoFi Stadium, the home stadium of the Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers, was selected as the host venue for Super Bowl LVI in 2017, as part of a bidding process. The stadium features a retractable roof and a seating capacity of 70,000, with the ability to expand to 100,000 for large events. The stadium's design includes a unique translucent roof, which allows natural light to enter the stadium.

### Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2021-2022 NFL season, including the Super Bowl. The NFL implemented various protocols to mitigate the spread of the virus, including mask mandates, social distancing, and reduced attendance. However, the pandemic also affected the availability of players and staff, with several teams experiencing COVID-related absences during the season.

**Teams**

### Los Angeles Rams

The Los Angeles Rams are a professional American football team based in the Los Angeles metropolitan area. The team was founded in 1936 and has won two Super Bowl titles, in 1999 and 2022. The Rams have a strong roster, featuring quarterback Matthew Stafford, wide receiver Cooper Kupp, and defensive tackle Aaron Donald.

### Cincinnati Bengals

The Cincinnati Bengals are a professional American football team based in Cincinnati, Ohio. The team was founded in 1968 and has appeared in two Super Bowls, in 1981 and 2022. The Bengals have a talented roster, featuring quarterback Joe Burrow, wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase, and defensive end Trey Hendrickson.

### Playoffs

The Los Angeles Rams and Cincinnati Bengals qualified for the playoffs as the top seeds in their respective conferences. The Rams defeated the Arizona Cardinals in the NFC Wild Card game, while the Bengals defeated the Tennessee Titans in the AFC Wild Card game. The Rams then defeated the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in the NFC Championship game, while the Bengals defeated the Kansas City Chiefs in the AFC Championship game.

### Pre-game notes

The Super Bowl LVI pre-game festivities featured a performance by the United States Marine Corps Band, as well as a coin toss ceremony. The game was officiated by a crew of seven referees, led by referee Bill Vinovich.

**Entertainment**

### Pre-game ceremonies

The pre-game ceremonies featured a performance by the United States Marine Corps Band, as well as a coin toss ceremony. The game was also preceded by a flyover of military aircraft.

### Halftime show

The halftime show featured a performance by Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar. The performance was a tribute to the legacy of hip-hop music and featured a number of memorable moments, including a surprise appearance by 50 Cent.

**Broadcasting**

### United States

#### Television

The Super Bowl LVI was broadcast on NBC, with Al Michaels and Cris Collinsworth serving as the play-by-play and color commentators. The game was also broadcast on various cable and satellite networks, including NBC Sports, NFL Network, and FOX Sports.

#### Advertising

The Super Bowl LVI featured a number of high-profile advertisers, including Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and Bud Light. The game also saw a number of notable ad campaigns, including a commercial by Apple that featured a surprise appearance by The Rock.

#### Streaming

The Super Bowl LVI was streamed live on various platforms, including NBC Sports, NFL Network, and the NFL app. The game was also available on streaming services such as Hulu and YouTube TV.

#### Radio

The Super Bowl LVI was broadcast on various radio networks, including Westwood One, SiriusXM, and NFL Radio. The game was also broadcast on a number of local radio stations across the country.

#### Ratings and viewership

The Super Bowl LVI drew a record-breaking audience of over 112 million viewers, making it the most-watched television program in U.S. history. The game also generated a significant amount of social media buzz, with the hashtag #SuperBowlLVI trending on Twitter throughout the game.

### International

The Super Bowl LVI was broadcast in over 180 countries and territories around the world, including Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, and Japan. The game was also streamed live on various international platforms, including the NFL International Network and the NFL app.

**Lists of feature films with LGBT characters**

The representation of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) characters in film has become increasingly prominent over the years. This article provides an overview of lists of feature films that feature LGBT characters, including notable films, film festivals, and awards.

**Notable Films**

The depiction of LGBT characters in film has evolved significantly since the 1960s. One of the earliest notable films featuring an LGBT character is the 1961 drama _The Children's Hour_, directed by William Wyler. The film tells the story of two women who are accused of having a romantic relationship, and it explores the consequences of their alleged affair.

## Classic Films

In the 1970s and 1980s, several films featuring LGBT characters gained critical acclaim. One notable example is the 1977 film _Carrie_, directed by Brian De Palma. The film features a lesbian character, Chris Hargensen, played by Nancy Allen. Another notable film from this period is the 1983 film _Making Love_, directed by Arthur Hiller. The film tells the story of two men who fall in love and explore the challenges they face in their relationships.

## Contemporary Films

In recent years, the representation of LGBT characters in film has increased significantly. One notable example is the 2005 film _Brokeback Mountain_, directed by Ang Lee. The film tells the story of two cowboys who fall in love and explores the challenges they face in their relationships. The film was a critical and commercial success, and it won several awards, including three Academy Awards.

## Films Featuring Bisexual Characters

Bisexual characters have also become more prominent in film over the years. One notable example is the 2013 film _Blue is the Warmest Color_, directed by Abdellatif Kechiche. The film tells the story of a young woman who falls in love with an older woman and explores the complexities of their relationship. The film was a critical and commercial success, and it won several awards, including the Palme d'Or at the 2013 Cannes Film Festival.

## Films Featuring Transgender Characters

Transgender characters have also become more prominent in film over the years. One notable example is the 2015 film _The Danish Girl_, directed by Tom Hooper. The film tells the story of Lili Elbe, a Danish trans woman who undergoes sex reassignment surgery. The film features a critically acclaimed performance by Eddie Redmayne, who plays the role of Lili Elbe.

**Film Festivals**

Several film festivals have become prominent in showcasing films featuring LGBT characters. One notable example is the Tribeca Film Festival, which has a dedicated section for LGBT films. Another notable example is the Outfest, which is a film festival dedicated to showcasing LGBT films. The festival features a range of films, including narrative features, documentaries, and short films.

## Berlin International Film Festival

The Berlin International Film Festival has also become a prominent platform for showcasing LGBT films. The festival features a range of films, including narrative features, documentaries, and short films. The festival has a dedicated section for LGBT films, and it has become a key platform for showcasing LGBT films from around the world.

## San Francisco International Film Festival

The San Francisco International Film Festival has also become a prominent platform for showcasing LGBT films. The festival features a range of films, including narrative features, documentaries, and short films. The festival has a dedicated section for LGBT films, and it has become a key platform for showcasing LGBT films from the San Francisco Bay Area.

**Awards**

Several awards have been established to recognize outstanding films featuring LGBT characters. One notable example is the GLAAD Media Awards, which are presented annually to recognize outstanding LGBT-themed films, television shows, and other media. Another notable example is the Berlin International Film Festival's Teddy Award, which is presented annually to recognize outstanding LGBT-themed films.

## GALECA Awards

The GALECA Awards are a set of awards presented annually to recognize outstanding LGBT-themed films, television shows, and other media. The awards are presented by the Guild of All Drama Critics, Alliances, and Lesbians, Actors, Critics, and Allies. The awards recognize excellence in a range of categories, including film, television, theater, and music.

## Q Awards

The Q Awards are a set of awards presented annually to recognize outstanding LGBT-themed films, television shows, and other media. The awards are presented by the Queer Arts International, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting LGBT arts and culture. The awards recognize excellence in a range of categories, including film, television, theater, and music.

article:
**Elvis (2022 film)**

The 2022 film Elvis is a biographical drama directed by Baz Luhrmann, written by Luhrmann and Craig Pearce, and starring Austin Butler as Elvis Presley and Tom Hanks as Colonel Tom Parker. The film explores the life of Elvis Presley, from his early days as a young musician to his rise to fame and his subsequent struggles with fame, family, and personal demons.

**Plot**

The film follows the life of Elvis Presley (Austin Butler), a young musician from Tupelo, Mississippi, who moves to Memphis to pursue a career in music. With the help of his manager, Colonel Tom Parker (Tom Hanks), Elvis becomes a sensation in the music industry, but his success comes at a cost. He struggles with his family, particularly his mother, Gladys (Kelly J. Baker), and his wife, Priscilla (Olivia DeJonge). As Elvis's fame grows, so does his dependency on prescription medication and his desire to escape the pressures of fame.

Meanwhile, Elvis becomes embroiled in the tumultuous world of 1950s rock 'n' roll, befriending other musicians such as Johnny Cash (Luke Treadaway) and Carl Perkins (Darrell Britt-Gibson). However, his relationship with Colonel Parker becomes increasingly strained as Elvis becomes more and more reclusive.

The film also explores Elvis's romantic relationships, including his marriage to Priscilla and his affairs with other women. Additionally, it touches on his struggles with racism and his experiences as a black musician in a predominantly white industry.

**Cast**

* Austin Butler as Elvis Presley
* Tom Hanks as Colonel Tom Parker
* Olivia DeJonge as Priscilla Presley
* Luke Treadaway as Johnny Cash
* Darrell Britt-Gibson as Carl Perkins
* Kelly J. Baker as Gladys Presley
* Helen Thomson as Minnie Mae Presley
* David Wenham as Vernon Presley
* Bryan Brown as Vernon Presley (older)
* Richard Roxburgh as Tom Parker (older)

**Production**

#### Development and casting

The film was first announced in 2015, with Baz Luhrmann set to direct and produce. Luhrmann had been a fan of Elvis for many years and had always wanted to make a film about his life. He spent several years researching and developing the project, working closely with Elvis's family to ensure that the film was accurate and respectful.

Austin Butler was cast as Elvis in 2017, after a long and grueling audition process. Luhrmann had seen Butler in a production of "Jekyll and Hyde" and was impressed by his performance. Butler had to undergo extensive vocal training to prepare for the role, learning to sing and mimic Elvis's distinctive voice.

Tom Hanks was cast as Colonel Tom Parker in 2018, after a series of meetings with Luhrmann and the film's producers. Hanks was drawn to the role by the complexity and nuance of Parker's character, and threw himself into the part, researching Parker's background and mannerisms.

#### Filming

Principal photography for the film began in November 2018 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in Australia, with many of the interior scenes filmed on soundstages. Luhrmann used a combination of traditional filmmaking techniques and cutting-edge technology to create the film's distinctive visual style.

The film's costume design was handled by Catherine Martin, who created a stunning array of costumes that reflected Elvis's various personas and styles. The movie's music was also carefully curated, with a mix of Elvis's original recordings and new music written specifically for the film.

#### Music

The film's soundtrack features a mix of Elvis's original recordings and new music written specifically for the film. Many of the film's key songs, including "Can't Help Falling in Love" and "Burnin' Love," were written by Elvis himself. Other songs, such as "Love Me Tender" and "Hound Dog," were written by other songwriters, but became closely associated with Elvis.

The film's score was composed by David Wenham, who worked closely with Luhrmann to create a musical style that was both nostalgic and contemporary. The score features a mix of traditional instruments and electronic elements, creating a unique and memorable soundtrack.

**Marketing**

The film's marketing campaign began several months before its release, with a series of teaser trailers and posters that showcased Austin Butler's performance as Elvis. The film's trailer was released in November 2021, and quickly went viral on social media.

The film's marketing campaign was handled by Warner Bros. Pictures, which released the film in several different formats, including IMAX and Dolby Cinema. The film's publicity team also worked closely with Elvis's estate and family to ensure that the film was respectful and accurate.

**Release**

#### 2022 original release

The film was originally released on June 24, 2022, in several different formats, including IMAX and Dolby Cinema. The film was a commercial success, grossing over $200 million worldwide in its opening weekend.

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising Austin Butler's performance as Elvis. The film's music and visuals were also widely praised, with many critics noting the film's unique and nostalgic style.

#### 2023 re-release

The film was re-released in January 2023, as part of a broader marketing campaign that included a new trailer and promotional materials. The re-release was a commercial success, grossing over $50 million worldwide in its opening weekend.

In 2023, it was announced that a four-hour cut of the film would be released, featuring extended scenes and additional music. The four-hour cut was intended to provide a more comprehensive and detailed look at Elvis's life and career.

**Canada national ringette team**

The Canada national ringette team is the national team representing Canada in international ringette competitions. Ringette is a fast-paced, high-scoring team sport played with a combination of hockey and lacrosse equipment, and is one of Canada's fastest-growing winter sports.

**Early history**

Ringette was invented in 1963 in North Bay, Ontario by Sam Jacks, a Canadian physical education instructor. The first organized game of ringette was played on October 7, 1963, between two teams of students from the North Bay Teachers' College. The game quickly gained popularity across Canada, and in 1965, the first national ringette championships were held in Edmonton, Alberta.

**World Championship record**

Ringette's international competitions include the World Ringette Championships, which are held every four years. Canada has dominated the tournament, winning 12 gold medals, 2 silver medals, and 1 bronze medal since its inception in 1990.

### Summit Series

In 1991, the World Ringette Championships were renamed the Summit Series, a name that reflects the high level of competition and the Canadian emphasis on excellence. Canada has won eight Summit Series championships, with its most recent title coming in 2017.

### Senior Canada

The Senior Canada team represents the country's top ringette players. The team has won 14 World Championships, including six Summit Series titles.

### Junior Canada

The Junior Canada team represents Canada's top junior ringette players. The team has won six World Championships, including two Summit Series titles.

**Team Canada Senior**

article:
Etharkkum_Thunindhavan

Etharkkum_Thunindhavan is a 2022 Indian Tamil-language action comedy film written and directed by Pandiraj. The film stars Sivakarthikeyan, Samyuktha Hegde, and Mohan Ram in the lead roles. The film is a remake of the 2016 Telugu film DJ: Duvvada Jagannadham, and it was released on February 11, 2022, coinciding with Maha Shivaratri.

Plot

The film revolves around Thavasi (played by Sivakarthikeyan), a honest and kind-hearted young man who runs a tea stall in a small town. He is known for his simple and honest nature, and the people in the town love and respect him. However, Thavasi has a secret: he is also a skilled martial artist and a daredevil who takes on the corrupt and ruthless men of the town. He is particularly known for his daredevil stunts, which he performs under the pseudonym "Thunindhavan."

Thavasi's life takes a turn when he falls in love with a beautiful woman named Saravanan (played by Samyuktha Hegde), who is a kind and gentle soul. However, their love is not accepted by Saravanan's family, who are wealthy and influential in the town. They try to force her to marry a man of their choice, but Thavasi is determined to win her heart and prove himself to be a worthy partner.

As Thavasi navigates his way through the complexities of love and relationships, he must also confront the corrupt and ruthless men who are threatening the town. He uses his skills and cunning to take them down, and his reputation as Thunindhavan grows. However, as the stakes get higher, Thavasi must confront his own demons and make a choice between his love for Saravanan and his desire for justice.

Release

Etharkkum_Thunindhavan was released on February 11, 2022, coinciding with Maha Shivaratri. The film was released in Tamil Nadu and other parts of India, and it was also released in several international markets.

The film was distributed by Lyca Productions, which has a strong presence in the Indian film industry. The distribution rights for the film were sold to several countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Middle East.

article:
**Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny**

**Introduction**

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is a 2023 American action-adventure film directed by James Mangold and produced by Lucasfilm. The fifth main installment in the Indiana Jones franchise, it follows the adventures of archaeologist Henry "Indiana" Jones Jr. as he searches for a powerful artifact known as the Dial of Destiny. The film stars Harrison Ford reprising his iconic role as Indiana Jones, alongside Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Mads Mikkelsen, and Thomas Kretschmann.

**Plot**

The film takes place in 1969, during the height of the Cold War. Indiana Jones, now in his 70s, is living in New York City and working as a professor at the University of Chicago. However, he is forced back into action when he is approached by his goddaughter, Helena Shaw (Waller-Bridge), who possesses a mysterious artifact known as the Dial of Destiny. The Dial is a powerful relic that has the ability to alter the course of history, and various factions are vying to obtain it.

As Indiana navigates the complex web of intrigue surrounding the Dial, he must also confront his own past and the consequences of his actions. Along the way, he teams up with a young and ambitious journalist, Jürgen Voller (Mikkelsen), who becomes entangled in the adventure. Together, they must outrun a group of ruthless agents, led by the sinister Baron Frankin von Frankenstein (Kretschmann), who will stop at nothing to claim the Dial for themselves.

**Cast**

* Harrison Ford as Henry "Indiana" Jones Jr.
* Phoebe Waller-Bridge as Helena Shaw
* Mads Mikkelsen as Jürgen Voller
* Thomas Kretschmann as Baron Frankin von Frankenstein
* Boyd Holbrook as Loxley
* Toby Jones as Remy
* Antonio Banderas as René Belloq
* John Rhys-Davies as Sallah

**Production**

### Development

The development of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny began in 2019, with James Mangold being announced as the director of the film. Mangold, a longtime fan of the Indiana Jones franchise, was tasked with bringing a new level of excitement and spectacle to the series. The script was written by Mangold and Jez Butterworth, with contributions from John-Henry Butterworth.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in earnest in 2020, with production designer Guy Hendrix Dyas and costume designer Michael Kaplan working on bringing the 1969 world to life. The film's score was composed by John Williams, who returned to the franchise after a 15-year absence.

### Casting

Harrison Ford was confirmed to reprise his role as Indiana Jones in 2020, marking his fifth appearance in the franchise. Phoebe Waller-Bridge joined the cast as Helena Shaw, a character described as "Indiana's goddaughter and a brilliant and feisty young woman." Mads Mikkelsen and Thomas Kretschmann were also announced as part of the cast, playing the roles of Jürgen Voller and Baron Frankin von Frankenstein, respectively.

### Filming

Principal photography on the film began in June 2021 and lasted for several months. Filming took place in various locations around the world, including the United Kingdom, Germany, and Italy. The film's stunt team, led by stunt coordinator Sam Hargrave, performed many of the film's complex action sequences.

### Visual effects

The film's visual effects were handled by Industrial Light & Magic, with a team of over 100 artists working on the film. The effects team used a combination of practical and digital techniques to bring the film's action sequences and set pieces to life.

### De-aging

The film's cast, particularly Harrison Ford, underwent extensive de-aging for the film. The de-aging process, which was handled by Industrial Light & Magic's de-aging team, involved using a combination of digital techniques and makeup to reduce the actors' ages.

**Music**

The film's score was composed by John Williams, who returned to the franchise after a 15-year absence. Williams' score incorporated many of the iconic themes from the previous Indiana Jones films, while also introducing new themes and motifs to suit the film's 1969 setting.

**Themes and influences**

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is a film that pays homage to the adventures of the past, while also exploring the themes of legacy and the consequences of one's actions. The film is influenced by the Cold War era, with its themes of espionage and international intrigue. The film also explores the idea of a character who is haunted by their past and struggling to come to terms with their own mortality.

**Release**

### Marketing

The marketing campaign for Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny began in earnest in 2022, with the release of a series of promotional posters and trailers. The marketing campaign focused on the film's action-packed sequences and its nostalgic value, with a particular emphasis on Harrison Ford's return to the franchise.

### Theatrical

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was released in theaters on June 30, 2023, in the United States and on July 5, 2023, in the United Kingdom. The film was released in several formats, including 3D, IMAX, and Dolby Cinema.

### Home media

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was released on digital platforms on September 19, 2023, and on DVD and Blu-ray on October 3, 2023.

**Reception**

### Box office

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny performed well at the box office, grossing over $900 million worldwide. The film's opening weekend was particularly strong, with the film grossing over $120 million in the United States.

### Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of the cast, particularly Harrison Ford and Phoebe Waller-Bridge. The film's action sequences and stunts were also widely praised, with many considering them among the best in the franchise.

### Accolades

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was nominated for several awards, including an Academy Award for Best Visual Effects and a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama for Harrison Ford.

**Future**

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is the fifth main installment in the Indiana Jones franchise, and it is possible that the film may lead to further adventures for the character. However, at this time, there are no plans for a sequel or spin-off film.

2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup

The 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup was the 40th edition of the AFC U-20 Asian Cup, the international youth football tournament organized by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) for men's under-20 national teams. The tournament was held in Uzbekistan from September 1 to 18, 2023.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup began in 2022, with 46 teams competing for a spot in the final tournament. The qualification process consisted of two rounds: the first round and the second round.

article:
**Lil Keed**

Lil Keed was an American rapper, singer, and songwriter from Atlanta, Georgia. He was a member of the hip-hop collective and record label, 1869, and was known for his unique blend of trap and melodic rap styles.

**Early Life**

Lil Keed was born on March 22, 1998, in Atlanta, Georgia. His real name was LaKeith Blue Williams, and he was the younger brother of rapper Lil Gotit. He grew up in the Kirkwood neighborhood of Atlanta, where he was exposed to hip-hop music from a young age. Lil Keed began rapping at the age of 12, and by the time he was 16, he had already started releasing music on social media platforms.

**Career**

Lil Keed's career took off in 2017, when he released his debut mixtape, "Keed Talk To 'Em". The mixtape gained attention from local hip-hop fans and critics, and it laid the groundwork for his future success.

### 2018: Trapped on Cleveland 2 and Keed Talk To 'Em

In 2018, Lil Keed released his second mixtape, "Trapped on Cleveland 2". The mixtape was a commercial success, and it featured the hit single, "LEMON TREE". The song's success was largely due to its catchy hook and Lil Keed's distinctive vocal style. "LEMON TREE" peaked at number 42 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, and it helped establish Lil Keed as a rising star in the hip-hop world.

### 2019: Long Live Mexico

In 2019, Lil Keed released his third mixtape, "Long Live Mexico". The mixtape was a critical and commercial success, and it featured the hit single, "FOR REAL". "FOR REAL" peaked at number 24 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, and it helped solidify Lil Keed's position as a leading figure in the hip-hop world.

### 2020: Trapped on Cleveland 3

In 2020, Lil Keed released his fourth mixtape, "Trapped on Cleveland 3". The mixtape was a commercial success, and it featured the hit single, "WORTH IT". "WORTH IT" peaked at number 35 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, and it helped establish Lil Keed as one of the most promising young rappers in the industry.

### 2023: Keed Talk to 'Em 2

In 2023, Lil Keed released his fifth mixtape, "Keed Talk to 'Em 2". The mixtape was a commercial success, and it featured several hit singles, including "LIFE LIKE". "LIFE LIKE" peaked at number 18 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, and it helped cement Lil Keed's reputation as a talented and innovative rapper.

**Musical styles**

Lil Keed's music is a unique blend of trap and melodic rap styles. He is known for his distinctive vocal style, which is characterized by his high-pitched, emotive delivery. Lil Keed's lyrics often focus on themes of street life, poverty, and personal struggle, but he also explores more introspective and emotional themes in his music.

### Influences

Lil Keed's music is influenced by a range of artists, including Gucci Mane, Lil Uzi Vert, and Travis Scott. He has also cited his brother, Lil Gotit, as a major influence on his music.

**Live performances**

Lil Keed was a prolific live performer, and he toured extensively throughout his career. He performed at several high-profile festivals, including Rolling Loud and A3C Festival. Lil Keed's live shows were known for their high energy and crowd-pleasing appeal.

**Death**

Lil Keed died on May 13, 2022, at the age of 24. The cause of death was a pulmonary embolism, which was related to a underlying medical condition. His death was met with widespread shock and grief from fans and fellow musicians, who remembered him as a talented and innovative rapper.

article:
**Testate Succession in South African Law**

Testate succession in South African law refers to the process of distributing the assets of a deceased person in accordance with their will. This article provides an overview of the key aspects of testate succession in South Africa, including the freedom of testation, testamentary capacity, formalities for executing a will, condonation, invalid wills, alteration or variation, incorporation by reference, and more.

**Freedom of Testation**

The freedom of testation is a fundamental principle in South African law, which allows testators to dispose of their property as they see fit. However, this freedom is not absolute and is subject to certain limitations.

### Limitations

#### Illegal dispositions and those against public policy

Testators cannot make dispositions that are illegal or go against public policy. For example, a testator cannot leave their property to a person who is not a citizen of South Africa or who is under a certain age.

#### Subdivision of agricultural land

The subdivision of agricultural land is subject to certain restrictions. A testator cannot divide their agricultural land into smaller plots without the permission of the Minister of Agriculture, Land Reform, and Rural Development.

#### Subdivision of mineral rights

The subdivision of mineral rights is also subject to certain restrictions. A testator cannot divide their mineral rights without the permission of the Minister of Mineral Resources and Energy.

#### Fideicommissum multiplex

A fideicommissum multiplex is a type of disposition that is subject to certain restrictions. It is a disposition that is made in favor of a person who is under a certain age or who is not a citizen of South Africa.

#### Maintenance of surviving spouse

A testator has a duty to maintain their surviving spouse. This means that the testator cannot leave their property to someone else without making provision for their spouse's maintenance.

#### Maintenance and education of minor children

A testator has a duty to maintain and educate their minor children. This means that the testator cannot leave their property to someone else without making provision for their children's maintenance and education.

#### Pension funds

Pension funds are subject to certain restrictions. A testator cannot leave their pension funds to someone else without the permission of the pension fund administrator.

### Delegation

A testator can delegate the administration of their estate to a person of their choice. This person is known as the executor.

### Customary law

Customary law plays an important role in South African law, particularly in the context of testate succession. The rules of customary law apply to the property of the testator and the distribution of the estate.

**Testamentary Capacity**

Testamentary capacity refers to the mental ability of the testator to make a valid will. This means that the testator must have the capacity to understand the nature and extent of their property, the consequences of their dispositions, and the effect of the will on the distribution of their estate.

### Mental ability of the testator

The testator must have the mental ability to understand the nature and extent of their property. This means that the testator must be able to understand the value and nature of their assets and liabilities.

### Undue influence on the testator

The testator must not be subject to undue influence. This means that the testator must not be coerced or persuaded into making a disposition that is not in their best interests.

**Capacity to Witness a Will**

A person who is not under a certain age or who is not a citizen of South Africa cannot witness a will. In addition, a person who is mentally incapacitated or who has a conflict of interest cannot witness a will.

**Formalities for Execution of a Will**

The formalities for executing a will are set out in the Wills Act. The testator must sign the will in the presence of two witnesses, who must also sign the will.

### Requirements for a Testamentary Disposition

A testamentary disposition must meet the following requirements:

*   The testator must have testamentary capacity.
*   The testator must have the mental ability to understand the nature and extent of their property.
*   The testator must not be subject to undue influence.
*   The disposition must be clear and unambiguous.

### Methods of Executing a Valid Will

A valid will can be executed in the following ways:

*   The testator can sign the will in the presence of two witnesses.
*   The testator can sign the will in the presence of a notary public.
*   The testator can sign the will in the presence of a medical practitioner.

### Signing and Signature

The testator must sign the will in their own handwriting. If the testator is unable to sign the will, the will can be signed by a medical practitioner or a notary public.

### Certificate

A certificate must be attached to the will. The certificate must be signed by the testator and two witnesses.

### Witnesses

Two witnesses must sign the will. The witnesses must be present when the testator signs the will.

**Condonation**

Condonation is a process that allows a person who has been excluded from a will to apply to the court for a share of the estate. The court will consider the following factors when deciding whether to grant condonation:

*   The relationship between the excluded person and the testator.
*   The reason for the exclusion.
*   The effect of the exclusion on the excluded person.

**Invalid Wills**

An invalid will is a will that does not meet the formalities for executing a will. An invalid will can be challenged in court.

### Revocation

A will can be revoked in the following ways:

*   A later will or codicil can revoke an earlier will.
*   Physical or symbolic destruction of the will can revoke the will.
*   Ademption can revoke the will.
*   Other means of revocation can revoke the will.

### Right of Revocation

A testator has the right to revoke their will at any time. This means that the testator can change their mind and make a new will.

### Manner

A will can be revoked in the following manners:

*   A later will or codicil can revoke an earlier will.
*   Physical or symbolic destruction of the will can revoke the will.
*   Ademption can revoke the will.
*   Other means of revocation can revoke the will.

### Exceptions to the General Rule that a Will Can be Revoked

There are exceptions to the general rule that a will can be revoked. For example, a will that is made in contemplation of marriage cannot be revoked if the marriage does not take place.

### Revival of a Revoked Will

A revoked will can be revived in the following ways:

*   A later will or codicil can revive an earlier will.
*   Physical or symbolic destruction of the will can revive the will.
*   Ademption can revive the will.
*   Other means of revocation can revive the will.

**Alteration or Variation**

An alteration or variation to a will can be made in the following ways:

*   An amendment by the testator can be made to the will.
*   A rectification by the court can be made to the will.
*   An alteration or variation by the court can be made to the will.

### Amendment by Testator

A testator can amend their will at any time. This means that the testator can change their mind and make a new will.

### Rectification by Court

A court can rectify a will if the testator did not have the capacity to make the will or if the will is ambiguous.

### Alteration or Variation by the Court

A court can alter or vary a will if the testator did not have the capacity to make the will or if the will is ambiguous.

**Incorporation by Reference**

A will can incorporate by reference another document or instrument. This means that the will can refer to another document or instrument that sets out the testator's wishes.

**Obsolete and Provincial Wills**

Obsolete and provincial wills are wills that are no longer valid. A will can be declared obsolete if it is no longer valid or if it is no longer in effect.

**Joint or Mutual Wills**

Joint or mutual wills are wills that are made by two or more people. A joint or mutual will can be made by two or more people who are married or who are in a civil union.

**Probate of Wills**

Probate of a will is the process of proving the validity of a will in court. Probate is required before the estate can be distributed.

### Lost Wills

A lost will can be probated if the testator can prove that the will existed and if the will can be found.

**Content of Wills**

The content of a will is the specific wishes and instructions of the testator. The content of a will can include the following:

*   Inheritance and legacy: The testator can leave their property to specific individuals or organizations.
*   Prior and legal rights: The testator can make provision for the prior and legal rights of certain individuals or organizations.
*   Vested, conditional, and future interests: The testator can make provision for vested, conditional, and future interests in their property.
*   Testamentary devices: The testator can use testamentary devices such as usufruct, substitution, and fideicommissum to distribute their property.

### Inheritance and Legacy

Inheritance and legacy refer to the transfer of property from one person to another. The testator can leave their property to specific individuals or organizations.

### Prior and Legal Rights

Prior and legal rights refer to the rights of certain individuals or organizations that must be respected when distributing the estate. The testator can make provision for prior and legal rights.

### Vested, Conditional, and Future Interests

Vested, conditional, and future interests refer to the rights of certain individuals or organizations to receive property in the future. The testator can make provision for vested, conditional, and future interests.

### Vested Interests

Vested interests refer to the rights of certain individuals or organizations to receive property immediately. The testator can make provision for vested interests.

### Conditional Interests

Conditional interests refer to the rights of certain individuals or organizations to receive property in the future if certain conditions are met. The testator can make provision for conditional interests.

### Future Interests

Future interests refer to the rights of certain individuals or organizations to receive property in the future. The testator can make provision for future interests.

### Valid and Invalid Conditions

Conditions can be valid or invalid. Valid conditions must be met for the interest to be transferred. Invalid conditions cannot be met for the interest to be transferred.

### Nudum Praeceptum

Nudum praeceptum is a Latin phrase that means "naked command." It refers to a condition that is not capable of being met. The testator cannot make a condition that is not capable of being met.

### Estate Massing

Estate massing refers to the process of consolidating the estate into a single entity. The testator can use estate massing to distribute their property.

### Customary Law

Customary law plays an important role in the distribution of the estate. The rules of customary law apply to the property of the testator.

### Testamentary Devices

Testamentary devices are legal tools that can be used to distribute the estate. The testator can use testamentary devices such as usufruct, substitution, and fideicommissum to distribute their property.

### Usufruct

Usufruct is a legal tool that allows the grantee to use the property but not to sell it. The testator can use usufruct to distribute their property.

### Substitution

Substitution is a legal tool that allows the grantee to substitute another person as the beneficiary of the property. The testator can use substitution to distribute their property.

### Direct Substitution

Direct substitution is a type of substitution where the grantee is substituted as the beneficiary of the property. The testator can use direct substitution to distribute their property.

### Fideicommissary Substitution

Fideicommissary substitution is a type of substitution where the grantee is substituted as the beneficiary of the property, but the property is still held by the testator. The testator can use fideicommissary substitution to distribute their property.

### Difference between Usufruct and Fideicommissum

Usufruct and fideicommissum are both legal tools that can be used to distribute the estate. However, usufruct allows the grantee to use the property but not to sell it, while fideicommissum allows the grantee to receive the property at a future date.

### Fideicommissum Residui

Fideicommissum residui is a type of fideicommissum where the grantee receives the property at a future date, but only if the testator dies before the grantee.

### Fideicommissum Pures

Fideicommissum pures is a type of fideicommissum where the grantee receives the property at a future date, regardless of whether the testator dies before the grantee.

### Trust

Trust is a legal tool that allows the grantor to transfer property to a trustee, who holds the property for the benefit of the beneficiary. The testator can use trust to distribute their property.

### Bequests Subject to a Modus

Bequests subject to a modus are bequests that are made to a grantee, but the grantee must perform a certain task or condition before receiving the property. The testator can make bequests subject to a modus.

### Interpretation of Some Common Dispositions in Wills

The interpretation of some common dispositions in wills can be complex. The court will consider the following factors when interpreting a disposition:

*   The language used in the will.
*   The context in which the disposition was made.
*   The intentions of the testator.

### Presumption Against Fideicommissa

There is a presumption against fideicommissa, which means that the court will not interpret a disposition as a fideicommissum unless it is clear that it is intended to be a fideicommissum.

### Si Sine Liberis Decesserit Clause

Si sine liberis decesserit clause is a Latin phrase that means "if there are no children." It is a type of condition that is often used in wills to determine who will inherit the property.

### Implied Fideicommissa

Implied fideicommissa are fideicommissa that are not explicitly stated in the will, but can be inferred from the language used. The court will consider the following factors when determining whether an implied fideicommissum exists:

*   The language used in the will.
*   The context in which the disposition was made.
*   The intentions of the testator.

### Fideicommissum Subject to a Si Sine Liberis Condition

Fideicommissum subject to a si sine liberis condition is a type of fideicommissum where the grantee receives the property at a future date, but only if there are no children.

### Prohibitions Against Alienation

Prohibitions against alienation are restrictions that prevent the grantee from selling or transferring the property to someone else. The testator can include prohibitions against alienation in their will.

### Statutory Aids to Interpretation

Statutory aids to interpretation are rules that help to clarify the meaning of a disposition in a will. The court will consider the following factors when interpreting a disposition:

*   The language used in the will.
*   The context in which the disposition was made.
*   The intentions of the testator.

### Combinations of Various Interests

Combinations of various interests are interests that combine multiple types of interests, such as vested, conditional, and future interests. The testator can include combinations of various interests in their will.

### Fideicommissum upon Fideicommissum

Fideicommissum upon fideicommissum is a type of fideicommissum where the grantee receives the property at a future date, and the property is still held by the testator, but the testator has made a fideicommissum to another grantee.

### Compendiosa Substitutio

Compendiosa substitutio is a type of substitution where the grantee is substituted as the beneficiary of the property, but the property is still held by the testator, and the testator has made a fideicommissum to another grantee.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct with a Direct Substitution as to the Usufruct at the Testator’s Death

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the usufruct at the testator’s death is a type of interest where the grantee receives the property at the testator’s death, and the property is subject to a usufruct, but the usufruct is transferred directly to the grantee.

Ownership subject to a usufruct as to which there is a fideicommissary substitution is a type of interest where the grantee receives the property at a future date, and the property is subject to a usufruct, but the usufruct is transferred to another grantee through a fideicommissum.

### Ownership Subject to a Usufruct with a Direct Substitution as to the Ownership at the Testator’s Death

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the ownership at the testator’s death is a type of interest where the grantee receives the property at the testator’s death, and the property is subject to a usufruct, but the ownership of the property is transferred directly to the grantee.

Ownership subject to a usufruct with a direct substitution as to the ownership at the death of the usufructuary is a type of interest where the grantee receives the property at the death of the usufructuary, and the property is subject to a usufruct, but the ownership of the property is transferred directly to the grantee.

Fideicommissum in which one fideicommissary is directly substituted for another is a type of fideicommissum where the grantee receives the property at a future date, and the property is still held by the testator, but the testator has made a fideicommissum to another grantee, and that grantee is substituted for the original grantee.

**Miss Universe Philippines 2023**

The Miss Universe Philippines 2023 was the 71st edition of the Miss Universe Philippines pageant, a beauty pageant organized by Carousel Productions. The pageant was held on February 25, 2023, at the Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay, Metro Manila, Philippines. The event was hosted by Kapamilya star, Luis Manzano and Miss Universe 2016, Pia Wurtzbach.

**Background**

### Selection of participants

The selection of participants for Miss Universe Philippines 2023 began in September 2022, when Carousel Productions announced the opening of the pageant's application period. A total of 30 candidates were selected to compete in the pageant through a series of screenings and interviews.

### Withdrawals

Before the pageant, two candidates withdrew from the competition. Miss Cebu, who was originally supposed to compete in the pageant, withdrew due to personal reasons. Miss Zamboanga, another candidate, also withdrew citing health reasons.

### Location and date

The Miss Universe Philippines 2023 pageant was held on February 25, 2023, at the Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay, Metro Manila, Philippines. The event was attended by a live audience and was also broadcast on television and online platforms.

### New titles

As part of the pageant's new format, the winners of the pageant were given new titles. The winner of the pageant was crowned as Miss Universe Philippines, while the first runner-up was crowned as Miss Universe Philippines Tourism. The second runner-up was crowned as Miss Universe Philippines Globe.

**Results**

### Placements

The top 5 contestants were:

1. **Miss Universe Philippines 2023:** Gabriela Basiano
2. **Miss Universe Philippines Tourism 2023:** Michelle Manzke
3. **Miss Universe Philippines Globe 2023:** Janela Joy Santos
4. **Miss Universe Philippines 2023 4th Runner-up:** Andrea Abaya

In addition to the top 5 contestants, the pageant also awarded appointments to the following contestants:

**Pageant**

### Format

The Miss Universe Philippines 2023 pageant followed a similar format to previous editions. The contestants competed in several rounds, including:

1. **Introduction:** Each contestant introduced themselves and answered a question from the host.
2. **Swimsuit:** The contestants modeled their swimsuits and answered questions from the judges.

5. **Q&A:** The top 5 contestants answered a question from the judges and were judged based on their answers.

article:
The 2022 Philippine presidential election was the 16th presidential election in the Philippines. It was held on May 9, 2022, with incumbent President Rodrigo Duterte's term ending on June 30, 2022.

# Background

The 2022 Philippine presidential election was the first to be held without the incumbent president seeking re-election. The election also marked the first time that the Philippines held a presidential election without a clear front-runner. The election was characterized by a crowded field of candidates, with 11 presidential and 10 vice presidential aspirants.

# Electoral system

The Philippines uses a first-past-the-post electoral system for presidential and vice presidential elections. Each voter casts one vote for president and one vote for vice president. The candidate with the most votes in each position wins.

# Candidates

## Ernesto Abella (Independent)

Ernesto Abella was a Filipino economist and former Secretary of the Department of Tourism. He announced his candidacy for president in November 2021, running as an independent candidate.

## Leody de Guzman (PLM)

Francis Pangilinan was a Filipino politician and former senator. He was the running mate of Leni Robredo in the presidential election.

## Standalone vice presidential candidate

### Manny Lopez (WPP)

Manny Lopez was a Filipino businessman and former presidential candidate. He ran for vice president as the candidate of the Workers' Party of the Philippines (WPP).

# Debates and forums

## Presidential debates and forums

The Commission on Elections (COMELEC) held three presidential debates and forums, which were broadcast on television and online. The debates were sponsored by the COMELEC, the Philippine Press Institute, and the Kapisanan ng mga Brodkaster sa Pilipinas.

## Vice presidential debates

The COMELEC also held two vice presidential debates, which were broadcast on television and online.

# Opinion polling

## For president

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign period to gauge public opinion on the presidential candidates. The polls showed a tight competition among the top candidates, with Bongbong Marcos and Leni Robredo leading the pack.

## For vice president

Opinion polls were also conducted to gauge public opinion on the vice presidential candidates. The polls showed a close competition among the top candidates, with Sara Duterte and Francis Pangilinan leading the pack.

# Campaign

## Issues

The issues that dominated the campaign period included the economy, corruption, and the COVID-19 pandemic.

## Start of campaign period for national positions

The campaign period for national positions began on February 8, 2022, and ended on May 7, 2022.

## Start of campaign period for local positions

The campaign period for local positions began on February 8, 2022, and ended on May 7, 2022.

## Miting de avance

The miting de avance was a campaign rally held by each candidate on the eve of the election. The rally was attended by supporters and featured speeches by the candidate and their running mate.

# Results

The unofficial results of the presidential election showed that Bongbong Marcos won with 31,629,995 votes, or 58.77% of the total votes cast. Leni Robredo came in second with 15,035,656 votes, or 27.95% of the total votes cast.

### Result by island group and region

The unofficial results of the vice presidential election showed that Sara Duterte won with 26,445,114 votes, or 52.83% of the total votes cast. Francis Pangilinan came in second with 12,837,173 votes, or 25.73% of the total votes cast.

### Result by island group and region

The results by island group and region showed that Sara Duterte won in all island groups and regions except for the National Capital Region (NCR), where Francis Pangilinan won.

## Results per province, city, diplomatic post and absentee voting category

The results per province, city, diplomatic post, and absentee voting category showed that Bongbong Marcos won in all provinces and cities except for the province of Maguindanao, where Leni Robredo won. Sara Duterte won in all diplomatic posts and absentee voting categories.

### Close places

The close places were provinces and cities where the margin of victory was less than 10,000 votes.

### Landslides

The landslides were provinces and cities where the margin of victory was more than 100,000 votes.

### Swing in Vote Share

The swing in vote share referred to the change in the percentage of votes cast for each candidate compared to the previous election.

## Unofficial tallies

The unofficial tallies were the results announced by each candidate's campaign on the eve of the election.

# Aftermath

## Election night

The election night was marked by a tense atmosphere as the results were announced. Bongbong Marcos was declared the winner, and Sara Duterte was declared the winner of the vice presidential election.

## Concessions

Leni Robredo and Francis Pangilinan conceded to Bongbong Marcos and Sara Duterte, respectively.

## Protests

Protests were held by supporters of Leni Robredo and Francis Pangilinan, who claimed that the election was marred by irregularities and cheating.

## International reactions

The international community welcomed the results of the election, with many congratulating Bongbong Marcos and Sara Duterte on their wins.

article:
Public hearings of the United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack

The Public hearings of the United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack were a series of public hearings held by the House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack, a committee established by the United States House of Representatives to investigate the January 6 United States Capitol attack. The hearings began on July 27, 2021, and continued through December 19, 2022.

# Schedule

The committee held a total of 10 public hearings between July 2021 and December 2022. The schedule of the hearings was as follows:

* July 27, 2021: Preliminary hearing
* June 9, 2022: First hearing – Primetime
* June 13, 2022: Second hearing
* June 16, 2022: Third hearing
* June 21, 2022: Fourth hearing
* June 23, 2022: Fifth hearing
* June 28, 2022: Sixth hearing
* July 12, 2022: Seventh hearing
* July 21, 2022: Eighth hearing – Primetime
* October 13, 2022: Ninth hearing
* December 19, 2022: Tenth hearing

# Background

The January 6 United States Capitol attack was a violent attack on the United States Capitol building in Washington, D.C. that occurred on January 6, 2021. The attack was carried out by a mob of supporters of then-President Donald Trump who stormed the Capitol in an attempt to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election. The attack resulted in the deaths of five people, including a police officer, and injured many others.

In response to the attack, the House of Representatives established the House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack to investigate the events surrounding the attack. The committee was tasked with examining the facts and circumstances surrounding the attack, as well as the actions of the Trump administration and other individuals and organizations involved.

# Preliminary hearing – July 27, 2021

## Participants

The preliminary hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as representatives from the Department of Justice and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

## Synopsis of preliminary hearing

The preliminary hearing was a brief session in which the committee outlined its plans and procedures for the investigation. The committee members discussed the scope of the investigation, which would include examining the actions of the Trump administration and other individuals and organizations involved in the attack.

# First hearing – June 9, 2022 – Primetime

## Participants

The first hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

## Synopsis of first hearing

The first hearing was a primetime hearing that focused on the events leading up to the January 6 attack. The hearing included testimony from former Attorney General William Barr, who confirmed that there was no evidence of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election.

### Opening statements by the panel members

The hearing began with opening statements by the committee members, who outlined the scope and purpose of the investigation. Chairman Thompson emphasized the importance of getting to the truth about the January 6 attack and holding those responsible accountable.

### Trump knew that he lost

The hearing also included testimony from former Attorney General William Barr, who confirmed that Trump knew he had lost the election. Barr stated that Trump's repeated claims of voter fraud were baseless and had no evidence to support them.

### Rush to issue presidential pardons

The hearing also touched on the Trump administration's rush to issue presidential pardons in the days leading up to the January 6 attack. The committee heard testimony from former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, who stated that Trump's advisors had warned him about the potential consequences of issuing pardons to individuals involved in the attack.

### Attack on the Capitol

The hearing also included testimony from former Capitol Police Chief Steven Sund, who described the violent attack on the Capitol building. Sund stated that the police were caught off guard by the ferocity of the attack and were overwhelmed by the sheer number of rioters.

### Pence called for the National Guard

The hearing also touched on the events of January 6, including Vice President Mike Pence's call for the National Guard to be deployed to the Capitol. The committee heard testimony from former National Security Adviser Robert O'Brien, who stated that Pence's request was denied by the Trump administration.

# Second hearing – June 13, 2022

## Participants

The second hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

## Synopsis of second hearing

The second hearing focused on the role of social media in the January 6 attack. The hearing included testimony from Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who stated that the company had taken steps to prevent the spread of misinformation on its platforms.

### Witness testimony

The hearing also included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former Facebook employee who testified about the company's handling of misinformation on its platform.

### Subpoena and absence of Bill Stepien

The hearing also touched on the committee's efforts to subpoena Bill Stepien, the Trump campaign's former manager, who had been called to testify before the committee. Stepien did not appear, citing a lack of cooperation from the Trump administration.

### Knowledgeable insiders dismiss voter fraud allegations

The hearing also included testimony from a number of knowledgeable insiders who dismissed the Trump administration's claims of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election. The committee heard testimony from a number of former Trump officials, including former Attorney General William Barr and former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, who stated that there was no evidence to support the claims of voter fraud.

### False claims appeared in Trump fundraising

The hearing also touched on the role of fundraising in the January 6 attack. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former Trump campaign official, who stated that false claims of voter fraud appeared in Trump's fundraising appeals.

# Third hearing – June 16, 2022

## Participants

The third hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

## Synopsis of third hearing

The third hearing focused on the role of the Vice President in the January 6 attack. The hearing included testimony from a number of witnesses, including former Vice President Mike Pence's counsel, who described the events of January 6.

### Experts testimony on the Constitutional role of the Vice President in the election

The hearing also included testimony from a number of experts, who discussed the Constitutional role of the Vice President in the election. The experts stated that the Vice President has a limited role in the election process and cannot unilaterally overturn the results of the election.

### Narrative of Vice President Pence and the events of January 6

The hearing also included a narrative of Vice President Pence's actions on January 6, including his decision to certify the electoral votes. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including former Vice President Pence's counsel, who stated that Pence was under pressure from the Trump administration to overturn the results of the election.

### Luttig warns about 2024

The hearing also touched on the potential consequences of the January 6 attack for the 2024 presidential election. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former federal judge, who stated that the attack could be a harbinger of violence and instability in the 2024 election.

# Fourth hearing – June 21, 2022

## Participants

The fourth hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

## Synopsis of fourth hearing

The fourth hearing focused on the role of state officials in the January 6 attack. The hearing included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former Georgia Secretary of State, who described the pressure they faced from the Trump administration to overturn the results of the election.

### Trump calls the Georgia Secretary of State

The hearing also touched on the events of January 6, including Trump's phone call to the Georgia Secretary of State. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including the Georgia Secretary of State, who stated that Trump's call was an attempt to pressure them into overturning the results of the election.

### Surrogates pressured the Arizona House leadership

The hearing also included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former Arizona House leader, who stated that Trump's surrogates pressured them to overturn the results of the election.

### Sean Riley "alternate electors" plan for Wisconsin and Michigan

The hearing also touched on the role of Sean Riley, a former Wisconsin state senator, who was involved in a plan to certify "alternate electors" in Wisconsin and Michigan. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including Riley, who stated that the plan was an attempt to undermine the results of the election.

### Impact of false fraud allegations on election workers

The hearing also touched on the impact of the false claims of voter fraud on election workers. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former election worker, who stated that the claims led to a culture of fear and intimidation among election workers.

### Reactions to fourth hearing

The hearing also included reactions from a number of individuals, including Trump, who denied any wrongdoing and claimed that the hearing was a "witch hunt".

The fifth hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

The fifth hearing focused on the role of the Trump administration's efforts to undermine the results of the election. The hearing included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who described the efforts to pressure the Department of Justice to investigate baseless claims of voter fraud.

The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who stated that Trump's language was an attempt to undermine the integrity of the election.

The hearing also included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who described the aborted attempt to install Jeffrey Clark as Attorney General. Clark was a Trump loyalist who was involved in the efforts to undermine the results of the election.

### Request for preemptive pardons

The hearing also touched on the role of Trump's request for preemptive pardons for himself and his allies. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who stated that the request was an attempt to insulate himself and his allies from accountability.

# Sixth hearing – June 28, 2022

The sixth hearing was attended by members of the House Select Committee, including Chairman Bennie Thompson and Vice Chairman Liz Cheney, as well as witnesses and experts who testified before the committee.

## Synopsis of sixth hearing

The sixth hearing focused on the events leading up to the January 6 attack. The hearing included testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who described the events of January 6.

The hearing also touched on the events of January 5, including the Trump administration's efforts to pressure the Department of Justice to investigate baseless claims of voter fraud. The committee heard testimony from a number of witnesses, including a former White House official, who stated that the efforts were an attempt to undermine the integrity of the election.

The hearing also included testimony from Cassidy Hutchinson, a former White House aide, who described the events of January 6. Hutchinson stated that Trump was involved in the efforts to undermine the results of the election and that he was aware of the violence that was unfolding at the Capitol.

**DC Universe (franchise)**

article:
Sarkaru Vaari Paata

Sarkaru Vaari Paata is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language action comedy film written and directed by Parasuram Petla. The film stars Mahesh Babu, Keerthy Suresh, and Samuthirakani, with Rashmika Mandanna and Vennela Kishore in supporting roles. The film was produced by Sithara Entertainments and 14 Reels Plus, with music composed by Thaman S and cinematography by R. Rathnavelu.

#Plot

The plot revolves around Keerthy Suresh's character, Harika, who marries Mahesh Babu's character, Keerthy's husband, for the sake of her family's financial stability. However, her husband's lack of financial stability causes her family to face difficulty. She then takes a loan from Pallavi (Rashmika Mandanna) to settle her family's debts, but Pallavi has other plans for the loan. Meanwhile, Keerthy's husband becomes involved in a series of misadventures with a loan shark (Samuthirakani), and things take a turn when the loan shark attempts to collect the loan from Keerthy. The rest of the story revolves around the events that unfold after this point.

#Cast

Mahesh Babu as Mahesh Babu's character (a man who takes a loan from Pallavi)
Keerthy Suresh as Harika (a woman who marries Mahesh Babu's character for the sake of her family's financial stability)
Rashmika Mandanna as Pallavi (a woman who takes a loan from Mahesh Babu's character)
Samuthirakani as the loan shark
Vennela Kishore as a sub-inspector (in a cameo appearance)
Tarun Arora as Mahesh Babu's character's friend
Anasuya Bharadwaj as a journalist (in a cameo appearance)
Sai Kumar as a don
Saranya Jonnalagadda as a police inspector
Bhumika Shetty as a girl in a school
Pradeep Rawat as a loan shark

#Production

##Development

Sarkaru Vaari Paata is the fourth collaboration between Mahesh Babu and Parasuram Petla, after the successful films Oopiri (2016), Geetha Govindam (2018), and Sarileru Neekevvaru (2020).

##Cast and crew

* Mahesh Babu: Mahesh Babu has been involved in various charitable initiatives throughout his career, including supporting the Telangana government's initiative to provide assistance to farmers affected by drought.
* Keerthy Suresh: Keerthy Suresh made her debut as a child artist in the Tamil film Idhu Kadhal Irudhi Kadhal (2008) and later appeared in films such as Sandamarutham (2015) and Rajinimurugan (2016).
* Rashmika Mandanna: Rashmika Mandanna is an Indian actress and model who has appeared in films such as Kirrak Party (2018), Geetha Govindam (2018), and Sarileru Neekevvaru (2020).
* Samuthirakani: Samuthirakani is an Indian actor and director who has appeared in films such as Thalaimurai (2013), Poriyan (2014), and Oru Indian Pranayakatha (2017).
* Thaman S: Thaman S is an Indian music composer who has composed music for films such as Dhammu (2012), Mirchi (2013), and Baahubali: The Conclusion (2017).

##Filming

The principal photography of Sarkaru Vaari Paata began in September 2020 and took place in various locations in the United States, including Atlanta and New York City. The film was shot using a combination of digital and 35mm film cameras.

#Music

The music for Sarkaru Vaari Paata was composed by Thaman S, who has previously worked with Mahesh Babu on films such as Mirchi (2013) and Srimanthudu (2015). Thaman S has composed music for over 100 films in various languages, including Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi. The soundtrack features six songs, including the title track "Sarkaru Vaari Paata," which was released in December 2021.

#Release

##Theatrical

Sarkaru Vaari Paata was released on May 12, 2022, in Telugu and other languages, including Hindi, Tamil, and Malayalam. The film was released in over 2,500 theaters worldwide, including the United States, the United Arab Emirates, and Australia.

##Home media

Sarkaru Vaari Paata was released on digital platforms, including Amazon Prime Video and Netflix, on June 10, 2022.

#Reception

##Box office

Sarkaru Vaari Paata was a commercial success, grossing over ₹120 crore (US$16 million) at the domestic box office and over ₹200 crore (US$26 million) at the international box office, for a worldwide total of over ₹320 crore (US$41 million). The film was a major breakthrough for Mahesh Babu, who had been struggling with the success of his previous films.

Wye, Kent

Wye is a village and civil parish in the Ashford District of Kent, England. Located in the North Downs, the village is situated near the River Stour and is accessible via the A28 and A229 roads.

#History

##RAF Wye
RAF Wye is a Royal Air Force station located near the village of Wye. The station was established in 1941 as a satellite airfield for RAF Manston and was used for fighter and bomber aircrew training during World War II. The airfield was also used for the testing of new aircraft and was home to the RAF's Central Fighter Establishment. Today, the airfield is no longer operated by the RAF and has been largely returned to agricultural use.

##Wye Racecourse
Wye Racecourse is a horse racing track located near the village of Wye. The course is a flat track that hosts several racing events throughout the year, including the Wye Park Stakes and the Wye Maiden Stakes. The course is owned by the Wye Park Estate and is operated by the Jockey Club.

##Wye Court
Wye Court is a 16th-century timber-framed house located in the village of Wye. The house is a Grade II* listed building and features a unique blend of medieval and Tudor architecture. Wye Court is now used as a dwelling house and is not open to the public.

##Wye College
Wye College was a constituent college of the University of London that was established in 1960. The college was located in the village of Wye and focused on providing undergraduate and postgraduate education in agriculture, forestry, and related subjects. Wye College merged with the University of London in 1999 and is now known as the Wye and Surrey College of Agriculture and Horticulture.

##Imperial College scheme
In 2013, the University of London announced plans to sell Wye College to Imperial College London. The sale was part of a wider plan to relocate Imperial College's Centre for Science and Innovation to the Wye campus. The sale was finalized in 2014 and has since seen significant investment in the campus, including the construction of new research facilities and student accommodation.
